title: When Sound Equipment goes through a Combine Harvester

tasks.task: Observing and describing a barley field and its differences from the speaker's previous garden experience.
subtasks: Noting the location and characteristics of the prairie field.
Distinguishing barley from wheat fields based on visual cues.
Comparing the type of agriculture (field crops vs. garden crops) suitable for prairie conditions.
Describing the role of machines in prairie farming compared to manual labor in the speaker's previous experience.

tasks.task: Touring agricultural machinery on a prairie farm.
subtasks: Viewing a swather's function in cutting and piling crop.
Observing a combine harvester's process of threshing, separating, and collecting grain.
Understanding the use of a dump truck for removing crops from the field.
Demonstrating the operation of an auger to transfer grain from the dump truck to storage bins.
Overcoming difficulties in recording due to the size and movement of farm equipment.
Adapting to environmental conditions (wind, equipment noise) for audio clarity.
Highlighting the farmer's expertise in maintaining machines integral to farming operations.
Recognizing the critical role of mechanics in prairie agriculture compared to manual farming practices.
